Key Arguments: The legislation represents government overreach under the guise of public concern.
There is skepticism about who will determine what is truthful and the moral grounds for such determinations.
The legislation could be used to silence differing opinions and beliefs, not just against the government but also other groups.
The proposal is seen as an attack on free speech, disguised as noble but potentially sinister and controlling.
Censorship is viewed as a slippery slope towards totalitarian rule.
